results.title: The Orange grower
results.brief_description: The story of an orange-grower and his family in the citrus fruit growing area of USA and how they raise and harvest their crop. Budding, pruning, planting, fertilising, irrigating, controlling weeds and pests, and combating extremes of temperature, are shown in detail.
results.description: The story of an orange-grower and his family in the citrus fruit growing area of USA and how they raise and harvest their crop. Budding, pruning, planting, fertilising, irrigating, controlling weeds and pests, and combating extremes of temperature, are shown in detail.

results.title: The Opposite sex. Parts 3 & 4
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Robin Hughes and Robin Hughes and Associates
results.brief_description: Part 3. Sex and emotion uncovers the complex interplay between hormones, experience and emotional behaviour and poses the question “In a world past the bomb, are we still unconsciously toughening our boys for hand to hand combat? and in a world past the pill, are our girls still being reared for a lifetime of childbearing?” “Part 4. Sex and society” Out in the world, as opposed to alone, the contrast between the sexes is striking. This episode traces the development of boys and girls from birth to discover how the gulf between masculine and feminine behaviour is created. The programs are interspersed with comments from ordinary people as well as experts to show the wide range of opinion from stereotype to enlightened.

results.title: The Opposite sex. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Ian Munro, Robin Hughes and Robin Hughes and Associates
results.brief_description: Dr. Norman Swan narrates this four part series on the differences between men and women. “Part 1. Sex and gender” investigates sexuality and what makes people sexually attractive to each other, concluding that more than the sum of genes, hormones and upbringing is involved. “Part 2. Sex and ability” poses the question “is there such a thing as a male or female brain?” and examines the latest research on the brain. Each program is interspersed with the personal views of ordinary people as well as experts, to demonstrate the range from stereotype to enlightened.

results.title: The Opportunity class
results.creator_credit: Richard Jones and Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Dept. of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A nursery class where handicapped and normal children mix in equal numbers, and where a support program for mothers of the handicapped is arranged. The progress of the children is followed from the nursery to later stages of their education. The attitudes of parents, nursery staff and the children’s later teachers are also explored.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Jones and Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Dept. of Film and Television

results.title: The Opening of the Baden Powell Hut at Brittania Creek, near Warburton, Victoria, October 1954
results.brief_description: Shows Baden Powell Hut opening near Warburton; Brownie Cottage; and a march past in the rain. Of historical value. No credits available.

results.title: The Opening of Parliament House
results.creator_credit: Paul Montgomery, Michael Fitzpatrick and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: With archival footage showing the opening of the old Parliament House and all the splendour of the historic opening of Australia’s new Parliament House, this video is a souvenir of a great occasion and a permanent record of a unique event. It includes the Governor General’s welcome to Her Majesty the Queen, the Honour Guard, a tour of the magnificent new building with its great architectural and engineering achievements and the opening ceremony itself.

results.title: The Open window
results.brief_description: Made with the assistance of Procine S.P.R.L., Brussels, Crown Film Unit and les Films d’Ariel, Paris; this film is devised as a camera impression of the landscape painting of these countries, selected from the works of their greatest painters. The painters whose work are included are Avercamp, Bonington, Bosche, Boudin, Bouts, Broughel, Claude, Constable, Corot, Courbet, Crome, Cuyp, David, De Keuninck, De Leyde, Fragonard, Grimmer, Hobbema, Huet, Jordaens, de Koninck, lancret, Manet, Memling, Michel, Millet, Monet, Wilson, Patenier, Potter, Poussin, Rembrandt, Renior, Rousseau, Rubens, Ruysdael, Stubbs, Turner, Van de Velde, Van Goyen, Verneer and Watteau.

results.title: The Olympiad = Olympia
results.brief_description: This is a contracted video version of Riefenstahl’s film of the 1936 Berlin Olympics. This program begins with a stylised glorification of ancient Greece, the carrying of the Olympic torch to Berlin and the opening ceremony. The action then follows the athletes performing events. Events covered include swimming, and diving, athletics, gymnastics, riding, rowing, cycling, yachting, shooting, hockey, polo and soccer. Unlike the film version which was intended as a glorification of the Nazi regime, this version shows all the athletes who won medals in the various sports, not simply focusing on the West German athletes.

results.title: The Olympia marathon sequence
results.brief_description: Excerpts from the English version of the 1936 German motion picture entitled “Olympia” directed by Leni Riefenstahl. Edited and released in the United States by Phoenix Films, 1973. Presents highlights from the marathon competition at the 1936 Olympic Games in Berlin, Germany.

results.title: The Old Stone Age
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the ice cap which covered northern Europe gradually receded to make way for forests inhabited by animals. Describes Old Stone Age man as primarily a hunter and shows his tools, carvings and caves. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
